title: Handling missing data
postscript: Earlier you learned about the index() method of arrays, which returns the position of an item inside an array. This actually returns an optional position, because the item might not be in the array.
question: Which of these make good candidates for optionals?
hint: Optionals are useful when you might not know some information or it might not exist.

correct.answer: The position of an item in an array.
correct.reason: The item may or may not exist in the array.
A person may or may not have a middle name

correct.answer: Someone's birthday if you know it.
correct.reason: You might not know their birthday.

correct.answer: The capital city of a country your user just typed in.
correct.reason: The user may have made a mistake with their typing and the country might not exist.

correct.answer: The current destination of a car's satellite navigation system.
correct.reason: There may or may not be a current destination set.

correct.answer: The year a user last went on a boat.
correct.reason: The user might not have ever been on a boat.

wrong.reason: Arithmetic like this always has an answer, even if that answer is 0.
All strings, even empty ones, have a length.

wrong.answer: An array of all languages spoken in your country.
wrong.reason: Even if there were a country where no one lived, the array would still exist -Â it would just be empty.

wrong.answer: The number of pages in a book.
wrong.reason: All books have a page count; even if all the pages are removed it would just have a page count of 0.

wrong.answer: The international dialling code for a country.
wrong.reason: All countries have an international dialling code.
All cities have a population count; even a deserted city has a population count of 0.
